title: Hurricanes defenseman Justin Faulk named alternate captain
text:
Hurricanes defenseman Justin Faulk named alternate captain 
Posted 11:41 a.m. today Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters More on this 
Raleigh, N.C. — One day prior to the 2015-16 season opener, the Carolina Hurricanes on Wednesday announced that defenseman Justin Faulk will serve as one of the team's alternate captains. 
Forward Eric Staal serves at the team's captain, and forward Jordan Staal is the other alternate. 
"Justin has emerged as an All-Star player in this league and a leader in our dressing room,” Carolina head coach Bill Peters said in a statement. “His leadership is on display every day in his commitment to his teammates and carries through to his dedication to the organization and our community.” 
Faulk is entering his fifth NHL season with the Hurricanes. Last year, he established career highs in goals (15), assists (34) and points (49) while playing in all 82 regular season games. 
Faulk was named to the 2015 NHL All-Star Game and competed for Team Toews at the event in Columbus, OH, earning two assists. 
Faulk was originally drafted 37th overall by the Hurricanes in the 2010 NHL Draft. Credits
